image.altText: ACT Education Directorate director-general Katy Haire in front of Campbell Primary School.

props.synopsis: The head of the ACT Education Directorate, Katy Haire, is taking legal action against the territory's Integrity Commission over its investigation into the Campbell Primary School expansion.

title.children: ACT education boss suing Integrity Commission in bid to stop Campbell Primary School expansion investigation

image.altText: A man smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: Glenn Walewicz was shot dead as he opened his door to three people in masks who were hoping to steal drugs and money from someone else who lived nearby.

title.children: Killer of Canberra man shot in mistaken identity case jailed for 13 years

image.altText: Telstra Shop signage outside Brisbane CBD store

props.synopsis: Telstra reveals plans to sack up to 2,800 workers as part of its latest cost-cutting measures, with most of these job losses to occur by the end of this year.

title.children: Telstra's 'massive change' has 'blindsided' workers, but will it pay off for customers and shareholders?

image.altText: Linda Reynolds perth court

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds says it's time for everyone to accept Justice Lee's findings that there was no political cover-up surrounding the rape of Brittany Higgins, as she continues a defamation case against her former staffer.

title.children: 'False narrative': Linda Reynolds slams Brittany Higgins cover-up claims as defamation case continues

image.altText: Rows of dead birds including skuas and penguins.

props.synopsis: A deadly strain of avian influenza has breached the world's most remote continent. Scientists say it's only a matter of time before it reaches Australia.

title.children: On the planet's most remote continent, a deadly virus is leaving a 'trail of destruction' that has scientists on edge

image.altText: Smoke rises over city of Noumea, in New Caledonia.

props.synopsis: The federal government says it has received clearance to send two planes to the French territory that has been rocked by a week of deadly riots and violence.

title.children: Australia sending evacuation flights to pick up those stranded in New Caledonia

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair sits on a pink couch and looks into the distance.

props.synopsis: When Jo O'Brien lost $500,000 to a scammer, she set out to track him down, eventually finding the man she believed was responsible. She sent him a text.

title.children: Jo was scammed out of $500,000. She threatened to 'ruin' lives to get her life savings back

image.altText: An iPhone shows various apps against a black background.

props.synopsis: Many Australian consumers are unaware of the extent of personal data being collected about them on a day-to-day basis, says a new report.

title.children: It would take almost 46 hours to read every privacy policy you agree to in a month. Here's why that's concerning

image.altText: Bill Shorten At National Press Club

props.synopsis: As a parliamentary hearing kicks off into draft legislation paving the way for changes to the NDIS, a governmental stoush has re-emerged. Here's what's going on.

title.children: Why the states and territories are clashing with the federal government over the NDIS

image.altText: A split image shows a computer with red logo taken from a still from the film Her, and a woman with green mesh over her face

props.synopsis: This week in tech news, OpenAI drops a new chatbot voice bearing a striking resemblance to Scarlett Johansson's, federal parliament discusses laws on political deepfakes, and the internet continues to be a terrifying place to be a teenager.

title.children: Deepfakes in an Australian election campaign would be legally fine, and OpenAI benches its flirty new chatbot voice

image.altText: Two soldiers holding a man with a mask with Benjamin Netanyahu's face on it.

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court prosecutor's office has requested arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his defence chief, and also for three Hamas leaders for alleged war crimes and crimes against humanity. So what happens next?

title.children: Why is the ICC seeking warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders, hasn't this already happened and who is involved? What you need to know

image.altText: A woman looks on with her hands behind her head.

props.synopsis: Matildas star Sam Kerr will miss the upcoming Paris Olympics after being officially ruled out because of an ongoing ACL injury.

title.children: Matildas star Sam Kerr officially ruled out of Olympics because of ACL injury

image.altText: people walking past large sandstone arches in uq st lucia's great court

props.synopsis: Wiley's Hindawi scandal offers a window into a thriving black market of fake science, corrupted research and bogus authorship. It also illuminates a much broader crisis of trust confronting universities and scientific institutions worldwide.

title.children: The Wiley scandal illuminates a much bigger crisis of trust confronting universities around the world

image.altText: A close up of Ebrahim Raisi wearing a black turban and looking over his shoulder while wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Ebrahim Raisi meticulously planned his rise to power in a brutal regime. But a freak accident brought him down at a critical moment in the Middle East.

title.children: 'He has so many enemies': Why the fiery death of the 'Butcher of Tehran' could spark chaos in Iran

image.altText: A composite image of women, one in a hijab crying and two with drinks in their hand.

props.synopsis: While government loyalists pack mosques and squares to pray for President Ebrahim Raisi, most shops remain open and the authorities make little effort to interrupt ordinary life.

title.children: While some women mourn the death of Iran's president, others hurt by the regime are celebrating

image.altText: A doctor in a hallway

props.synopsis: An Australian doctor reveals how he travelled to Gaza to volunteer but has become trapped in the war zone following Israel's seizure and closure of the Rafah border crossing.

title.children: 'We've been left stranded here': An Australian doctor volunteered to save lives in Gaza, but is now trapped

image.altText: Nina taking a selfie with her son Jerome, both are smiling.

props.synopsis: Children are gathering large followings and earning thousands of dollars through social media influencing — but some warn it comes with a dark side.

title.children: Jerome is a 4yo model who makes thousands of dollars. But his social media fame has a dark side

image.altText: A pile of capsicums on sale in a box at a grocery store for $12.90 per kilogram.

props.synopsis: Shoppers wondering why capsicums, especially red ones, are so expensive can blame the weather at one end of the country and a single tiny fly at the other.

title.children: Supply down, costs soar for fruit and veggies as growers battle fruit fly measures

image.altText: cannabis, medicinal

props.synopsis: Medicinal cannabis patients will be allowed behind the wheel as part of a new government study to test their impairment.

title.children: Victoria is launching a trial exploring medicinal cannabis patients being allowed to drive. Here's how it will work

image.altText: Elizabeth Henry with three of her children.

props.synopsis: The 30-year-old was last seen alive in the inner city Brisbane suburb of Fortitude Valley shortly before midnight on February 11, 1998.

title.children: Family of murdered mother-of-six says information about her killer should not be taken to the 'grave'

image.altText: ANZ

props.synopsis: The Australian share market falls as Telstra reveals plans to sack 2,800 workers, US tech stocks drive the Nasdaq to a record high, and optimism about rate cuts pushes gold and copper prices to their highest levels ever. Follow live.

title.children: ANZ hit with online banking outage, ASX slips as Telstra confirms job cuts, Nasdaq and gold hit record highs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Thanks to Taylor Swift and the WWE, airline passenger numbers hit 2019 highs
Consumer sentiment remains 'deeply pessimistic': Westpac report
ANZ hit with system outage affecting online banking and mobile app

image.altText: Colourful shipping containers stacked on top of the other, with high-rise buildings in the distance.

props.synopsis: We've joined our global peers by embracing the new economic mood in pursuit of a Future Made in Australia. But it remains to be seen whether we've learnt anything from the successes and failures of globalisation over the past 30 years.

title.children: The world is retreating from globalisation. What does it mean for us?

image.altText: Peter Dutton standing at a lectern.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton used his budget reply speech to excoriate the government while at the same time pumping up his own record as a minister. But did he stick to the facts?

title.children: We fact checked some of the claims from Peter Dutton's budget reply. Here's what we found

image.altText: Table strewn with old photos, cards, books, jewellery, a tea cup, small clock, carved jewellery box and pop culture ornament

props.synopsis: This museum curator explains why we should bring our childhood toys, old band T-shirts and family heirlooms out of hiding and honour them for the memories they contain.

title.children: How to honour your boxes of sentimental 'stuff' and know when to let them go

image.altText: Great cormorant spreads it wings.

props.synopsis: Fish farm employees shot dozens of native seabirds which were taking salmon from Tasmanian pens in an effort to deter them, documents reveal — with the scare tactic failing in part because the cormorants were unfazed, even if the bird next to them was shot.

title.children: Other birds would scatter when salmon farm workers shot at them — but not this bird species

image.altText: Scarlett Johansson at Avengers premiere.

props.synopsis: OpenAI says it plans to halt the use of a ChatGPT voice that resembles Johansson, who famously voiced a fictional, and at the time futuristic, AI assistant in the 2013 film Her.

title.children: Scarlett Johansson 'shocked' by ChatGPT voice 'eerily similar' to her own

image.altText: A woman sits on concrete steps outside a house. She is in a black dress with red flowers, has brown skin and looks calm.

props.synopsis: For the first time, two Australian festivals have been chosen for the prestigious Goes to Cannes program.

title.children: Bina never thought she'd get to go to Cannes Film Festival, but she's made it with her debut feature

image.altText: An elderly man smiles at the camera holding an award.

props.synopsis: British-born Australian country music singer Frank Ifield has died at the age of 86 at his home in Dural, NSW. He had multiple number one hits and famously helped give The Beatles their start when he was approached by their manager, Brian Epstein.

title.children: Australian singer Frank Ifield, who helped give The Beatles their start, dies aged 86

image.altText: A school building on the left and a water bottle on the right.

props.synopsis: School says "reduced noise and fewer rest room breaks" are among early positive results of a trial to improve the classroom environment and student concentration.

title.children: Prestigious school's trial ban on water bottles in class divides teachers, students

image.altText: England captain Ben Stokes makes a T with his hands to review a catch of Australia batter Steve Smith, who is looking on.

props.synopsis: The tumultuous and at-times tempestuous 2023 Ashes is the subject of the third season of docuseries The Test, with cameras given access to the Australian locker room during the drama-filled contest.

title.children: New docuseries reveals Steve Smith at odds with teammates over another Spirit of Cricket debate in Ashes

image.altText: A Fiji Airways plane in flight, with a grey cloudy sky in the background.

props.synopsis: Air Vanuatu's collapse has raised questions about the future of aviation in the Pacific. While experts say the problems are vast, there are glimmers of hope for the region's airlines.

title.children: Air Vanuatu collapsed under heavy debt. A thousand kilometres across the ocean, it's a different story

image.altText: Houses on a cliff edge in the northern Illawarra region.

props.synopsis: Extreme weather linked to climate change risks negatively affecting coastal property market values, as storm-related damage and erosion takes its toll and insurance premiums soar.

title.children: 'People are still buying … regardless of the risks': Insurers warn hundreds of thousands of homes are under threat
